dataset.title: Increased Organic Carbon Burial in Northern Florida Mangrove-Salt Marsh Transition Zones
dataset.abstract: Salt marshes and mangroves are recognized globally as blue carbon habitats, burying large amounts of carbon with limited area, but they also are increasingly susceptible to current climate change. Rising temperatures and decreasing freeze frequencies are resulting in replacement of salt marshes along the southern United States by mangroves. Our results show surface soils from wetlands along northern Florida Atlantic and Gulf coasts had higher apparent sedimentation rates in mangrove-dominated sites (1.5-3.2 mm yr-1) and where mangroves are migrating into the marsh (termed transition sites, 2.3-3.8 mm yr-1). Average carbon burial rates were higher in transition sites for both coasts (27-47 gC m-2 yr-1) compared to the respective mangrove (10-22 gC m-2 yr-1) and salt marsh (4-7 gC m-2 yr-1) sites. Lignin biomarker data (_-6, _-8, C/V) indicated mangrove and transition sites had higher lignin inputs from woody vascular plants compared to salt marsh sites. Higher amino acid concentrations in mangrove soils relative to mangrove biomass (1.8-2.3 mmol gC-1 vs. 0.2-0.9 mmol gC-1) and lower C/N indicated these mangrove sites receive higher algal inputs than the transition and salt marsh sites and we attribute this difference to greater tidal inundation in the mangrove sites given their position near the shoreline.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Code indicating what type of device was used to collect soil depth profiles.

codeDefinition.definition: A technique involving collecting a core by sinking a continuous pipe into sediment attaching a source of vibration, then recovering using a winch and pulley

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether live roots were included or excluded from carbon assessments.

codeDefinition.definition: Roots and rhizomes were included in dry bulk density and or organic matter and carbon measurements

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether or not sediment was sieved prior to carbon measurements.

codeDefinition.definition: Sediment was sieved prior to analysis for organics

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating how the authors qualified or quantified compaction of the core.

codeDefinition.definition: Authors observed no obvious compaction

attribute.attributeDefinition: Sample volume used for bulk density measurements, if held constant.
Any notable codes regarding how the authors quantified dry bulk density.

codeDefinition.definition: Bulk density was measured on freeze dried samples

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether or not carbonates were removed prior to calculating fraction organic carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were removed before measuring organic carbon.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The method used to remove carbonates prior to measuring fraction carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were removed by fumigating with concentrated acid

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether fraction carbon was measured or estimated as a function of organic matter.

codeDefinition.definition: Fraction carbon was measured as opposed to modeled

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method for which fraction carbon was measured or modeled (Note: regression based models are permitted, but the use of the Bemmelen factor [0.58 gOC gOM-1] is discouraged).

codeDefinition.definition: Each sample presented was measured using Elemental Analysis

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether fraction_carbon refers to organic or total carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Author specified that fraction carbon measurements were of organic carbon

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method used for determining radiocesium activity.

codeDefinition.definition: Gamma counting method used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method used for determining lead 210 activity.

codeDefinition.definition: Gamma counting method used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the assumption used to estimate the core's background 226Ra levels.

codeDefinition.definition: 226Ra was measured for each sample

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the reference or 0 year of the age depth model.

codeDefinition.definition: Year zero is set according to Common Era and Before Common Era standards

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Date of core collection.
Positional latitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Positional longitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Code indicating how latitude and longitude were determined.

codeDefinition.definition: Conventional Commercially available hand-held GPS

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how latitude and longitude were determined.

Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating average annual salinity (Note: Palustrine and freshwater should only include tidal wetlands, or wetlands that are potentially/formerly tidal but artificially freshened due to artificial tidal restrictions).

codeDefinition.definition: 0.5-35 ppt according to most definitions

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether salinity_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement

codeDefinition.definition: Salinity inferred by field observation such as vegetation

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code based on submitter field observations or measurement indicating dominant wetland vegetation type.

codeDefinition.definition: Describes wetlands dominated by persistent emergent vascular plants
Describes wetlands dominated by woody vegetation < or equal to 5 meters in height

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether vegetation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement

codeDefinition.definition: Vegetation measured by counts or plots.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating how often the coring location is inundated.

codeDefinition.definition: Study-specific definition of an elevation relatively high in the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type
Study-specific definition of an elevation in the relative middle of the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether inundation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement

codeDefinition.definition: Inundation inferred by field observation such as vegetation

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Minimum depth of a sampling increment.
Maximum depth of a sampling increment.
Sample identification unique to the core. This should be used in the case that there are relevant lab specific sample codes, or in the case that there are multiple replicate samples.
Dry mass per unit volume of a soil sample. This does not include ash free bulk density.
Mass of carbon relative to sample dry mass.
Radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for radiocesium (137Cs).
1 standard deviation of uncertainty associated with cs137_activity.
Total radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for excess lead 210 (210Pb).
1 standard deviation of uncertainty associated with total_pb210_activity.
Total radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for Radium 226 (226Ra) if measured as part of the 210Pb dating process.
1 standard deviation of uncertainty associated with ra226_activity.
Excess radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for excess lead 210 (210Pb).
1 standard deviation of uncertainty associated with excess_pb210_activity.
The isotopic signature of 13C. This is oftentimes measured along with c14_age and can be useful for analyzing carbon lability and provenance.
Age of soil at depth as determined by excess Pb-210 activity using the constant rate of supply (CRS) model
Standard error of age estimation of soil at depth as determined by excess Pb-210 activity using the constant rate of supply (CRS) model
Molar ratio of total organic carbon to total nitrogen
Mean calibrated radiocarbon date using the age-depth BACON (Bayesian accumulation histories for deposits) calibration model
Minimum calibrated radiocarbon date using the age-depth BACON (Bayesian accumulation histories for deposits) calibration model
Maximum calibrated radiocarbon date using the age-depth BACON (Bayesian accumulation histories for deposits) calibration model
summation of vanillyl (V), syringyl (S), and cinnamyl (C) lignin phenols normalized to 100 mg of OC
summation of V and S phenols normalized to 100 mg OC
ratio of C phenols to V phenols, used to estimate non-woody vs. woody vascular plant inputs
ratio of S phenols to V phenols, used to estimate angiosperm vs. gymnosperm vascular plant inputs
acid-to-aldehyde ratios of the vanillyl lignin phenol group, used as a degradation indicator
acid-to-aldehyde ratios of the syringyl lignin phenol group, used as a degradation indicator
summation of 19 amino acids that were detected and quantified, normalized to OC
Fraction of which the 19 amino acids made of the total nitrogen pool
Amino acid degradation index generated from mole percentages of each amino acid in a principal component analysis
Carbon-normalized concentration of the individual amino acid Diaminopimelic acid (DAPA)
Carbon-normalized concentration of the individual amino acid gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA)
Carbon-normalized concentration of the individual amino acid hydroxyproline (Hyp)
Carbon-normalized concentration of the individual amino acid muramic acid (MurA)

unit.name: disintegrationPerMinutePerGram
unit.description: disintegrations per minute per gram is a measure of the activity of the source of radioactivity

unit.name: milligramsPerOneHundredMilligramsOrganicCarbon
unit.description: summation of measured object normalized to 100 mg organic carbon

unit.name: millimolesPerGramOrganicCarbon
unit.description: Concentration normalized to 1 g organic carbon

unit.name: micromolesPerGramOrganicCarbon
unit.description: Concentration normalized to 1 g organic carbon
